intro: Persoonia adenantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaf burr-ace, is a shrub native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and distinctive seed pods. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually small and white or pink, and it produces hard, woody seed capsules that split open to release seeds. Persoonia adenantha is often used in local horticulture for its ornamental value and ecological importance in native plant communities.
